*p**location_mentioned*Station on the Labaca*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-27-1827">26th febuary 1827*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear sir*/p*
*p*I am sorry to be the herrold of bad news—*person_mentioned*Baptist Lacount*/person_mentioned* came here *date_mentioned n="02-25-1827">2 days since*/date_mentioned* who states that a very large band of *person_mentioned*Comanches*/person_mentioned*, and *person_mentioned*Weehoes*/person_mentioned*, had attacked *person_mentioned*Cahoe*/person_mentioned*'s party of the *person_mentioned*lepans*/person_mentioned*, and nearly all the *person_mentioned*tonkowas*/person_mentioned*, on the *location_mentioned*San Marcos rio*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*about 9 miles above the Town of Gonzalez*/location_mentioned*—that the *person_mentioned*lepans */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*tonkowas */person_mentioned*were whiped with the loss of 5 or 600 horses, and that they retreated *location_mentioned*down the river*/location_mentioned*—some of them (the *person_mentioned*lepans*/person_mentioned*) are now at *location_mentioned*Delions*/location_mentioned*—the *location_mentioned*fort at Gonzales */location_mentioned*was not finished, and what few men was there were in greate danger— some of them talke'd of leaving the place, another defeat in attempting to settle the *location_mentioned*Sn Marks*/location_mentioned* if not already, will soon take place.*/p*
*p*Inclosed you will have some certificates—I have call'd on the *location_mentioned*Colo*/location_mentioned*, to make out certificates relative to . . . guns, and those that were in his charg, but [he has] not done so.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*here seeme industrious, and are useing much exertions to plant corn etc they are all in good health. They are anxious that the *location_mentioned*Colo*/location_mentioned*, should appoint some person as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*in fact to manage his business------think of this------and perhaps you had better write to him—*/p*
*p*We have had a great [d]eal of rain; so much that we can not plant:*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Kerr*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Note Please write to me by the first opportunity*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo S. Austin*/person_mentioned**location_mentioned* San felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* Care of *person_mentioned*Major Philips */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="02-26-1827">26th February*/date_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Capt Lockhart*/person_mentioned* has just came from *location_mentioned*Gonzales */location_mentioned*and [states] that, he quit surveying and joined the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*and assisted in building the *location_mentioned*fort*/location_mentioned*—that they resolved to keep the place etc and that they [are] planting corn there. Be will return *date_mentioned n="02-27-1827">tomorrow*/date_mentioned*. Could a small piece of arteary [artillery] be obtained from the Govt, it would no doubt be of great utility to that place—would be glad if you would mention this to *person_mentioned*His Excellency the Chief of the Department*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Kerr*/person_mentioned**/p* */div1*
